column4: I'm trying to follow the "FixVideoResoution" instructions, but when I run aticonfig it says no such command, and I don't see it in Synaptic?  What can I do to run that command on this machine?
have you installed xorg-driver-fglrx?
I'll check
that's the binary ati driver
plus aticonfig
I don't have that installed
well then you hadn't installed the ati driver in the first place
I'm installing it now

running aticonfig --initial etc. ... gives me two "Monitor" and "Screen" sections in xorg.conf ... the old one and a new one that it apparantly just wrote.  That doesn't seem right.  Should I delete the old sections?
to be honest I'm not familiar with aticonfig I did it by hand. but I'd guess you could purge the old sections yes
ok ... we made "some" progress
before .... with the 1440x900 settings, it would boot to a black screen after login ... now it boots to the wallpaper, but still no sound or loading the rest of Gnome.
... or anyone ..... before .... with the 1440x900 settings, it would boot to a black screen after login ... now it boots to the wallpaper, but still no sound or loading the rest of Gnome.

... you got any more ideas for me? ..... before .... with the 1440x900 settings, it would boot to a black screen after login ... now it boots to the wallpaper, but still no sound or loading the rest of Gnome.
I have to switch it back to 1024x768 to get it to finish
I don't know what's up. everyone seems to have weird problems today
I know this probably doesn't make sense, but would it be any different perhaps if I tried xfce
I doubt it. try
alsamixer
that opens the bar graphs ... but no way to change them
oh
